text.0: the friends who offer soma long to find thee they pour forth soma and present their viands.
text.1: they bear unmoved the cursing of the people for all our wisdom comes from thee o indra.
text.2: not far for thee are midairs loftiest regions start hither lord of bays with thy bay horses.
text.3: made for the firm and strong are these libations the pressingstones are set and fire is kindled.
text.4: fair cheeks hath indra maghavan the victor lord of a great host stormer strong in action.
text.5: what once thou didst in might when mortals vexed theewhere now o bull are those thy hero exploits.
text.6: for overthrowing what hath neer been shaken thou goest forth alone destroying vṛtras.
text.7: for him who followeth thy law the mountains and heaven and earth stand as if firmly stablished.
text.8: yea muchinvoked in safety through thy glories alone thou speakest truth as vṛtras slayer.
text.9: een these two boundless worlds to thee o indra what time thou graspest them are but a handful.
text.10: forthwith thy bay steeds down the steep o indra forth crushing foemen go thy bolt of thunder.
text.11: slay those who meet thee those who flee who follow make all thy promise true be all completed.
text.12: the man to whom thou givest as provider enjoys domestic plenty undivided.
text.13: blest indra is thy favour dropping fatness thy worship muchinvoked brings gifts in thousands.
text.14: thou indra muchinvoked didst crush to pieces kunaru handless fiend who dwelt with danu.
text.15: thou with might indra smotest dead the scorner the footless vṛtra as he waxed in vigour.
text.16: thou hast established in her seat o indra the level earth vast vigorous unbounded.
text.17: the bull hath propped the heaven and airs midregion by thee sent onward let the floods flow hither.
text.18: he who withheld the kine in silence i yielded in fear before thy blow o indra.
text.19: he made paths easy to drive forth the cattle loudbreathing praises helped the muchinvoked one.
text.20: indra alone filled full the earth and heaven the pair who meet together rich in treasures.
text.21: yea bring thou near us from the airs midregion strength on thy car and wholesome food o hero.
text.22: sūrya transgresses not the ordered limits set daily by the lord of tawny coursers.
text.23: when to the goal he comes his journey ended his steeds he looses this is indras doing.
text.24: men gladly in the course of night would look on the broad bright front of the refulgent morning.
text.25: and all acknowledge when she comes in glory the manifold and goodly works of indra.
text.26: a mighty splendour rests upon her bosom bearing ripe milk the cow unripe advances.
text.27: all sweetness is collected in the heifer sweetness which indra made for our enjoyment.
text.28: barring the way they come be firm o indra aid friends to sacrifice and him who singeth.
text.29: these must be slain by thee malignant mortals armed with ill arts our quiverbearing foemen.
text.30: a cry is beard from enemies most near us against them send thy fiercestflaming weapon.
text.31: rend them from under crush them and subdue them slay maghavan and make the fiends our booty.
text.32: root up the race of rākṣasas o indra rend it in front and crush it in the middle.
text.33: how long hast thou bebaved as one who wavers cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion.
text.34: when borne by strong steeds for our weal o leader thou seatest thee at many noble viands.
text.35: may we be winners of abundant riches may indra be our wealth with store of children.
text.36: bestow on us resplendent wealth o indra let us enjoy thine overflow of bounty.
text.37: wide as a sea our longing hath expanded fulfil it o thou treasurelord of treasures.
text.38: with kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty skill extend it.
text.39: seeking the light with hymns to thee o indra kuśikas have brought their gift the singers.
text.40: lord of the kine burst the kines stable open cows shall be ours and strength that wins the booty.
text.41: hero whose might is true thy home is heaven to us o maghavan grant gifts of cattle.
text.42: call we on maghavan auspicious indra best hero in this fight where spoil is gathered.
text.43: the strong who listens who gives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers riches.
